brand.intro: Many people feel Britain is struggling, caught between headlines of crisis and waves of outrage. The Broken Britain Briefing sets out to move beyond that cycle, examining the evidence with clarity and perspective. Our papers assess the country’s real condition and the policies intended to improve it, aiming to ground debate in facts and thoughtful scrutiny rather than despair or division.

national.title: A Year of Labour
national.description: Assessing Labour’s first year in office: actions, outcomes, misses. We focus on policies and results, not drama and headlines, to learn what the government is doing and what it could do better.

national.title: Online Safety Act — Explainer, Timeline & Responsible Actors
national.description: What the OSA actually does, who made it, how platforms are supposed to protect kids, and how some are already pushing that responsibility onto users.

national.title: Gaming and Radicalisation, from the Inside
national.description:
How gaming platforms fuel radicalisation; moderation gaps and potential fixes.

A report on how and why gamers have long been an appealing target for agitators.

national.title: Opening All The Windows on Prison Reform
national.description: An exploration of public opinion on prisons reform, and the costs and benefits of the ECHR (and other regulations) for prisoners and citizens.

local.title: Manchester Fly Tipping Causes
local.description: Why dumping happens, why it's become such a problem, and the difference between simply punishing hard to catch offenders and addressing the root causes.

local.title: Manchester GP Practices — Review Scores
local.description: Patient feedback mapped against outcomes and deprivation. Looking at why so many practices are failing their patients, but don't seem able to realise it.

microsites.title: Immigrants vs Billionaires
microsites.description: Interactive UK proxy chart comparing immigration costs and benefits with billionaire-linked extraction costs.

microsites.title: Woke vs Anti-woke
microsites.description: A blunt “woke or anti-woke” vibe check: what do you believe? or are you just 'normal'?

microsites.title: Labour screw-ups
microsites.description: A source-linked timeline of reversals, broken pledges, and messy climbdowns — filterable by actor, category, state, and U-turn flags.

microsites.title: Elon Musk is our least problematic billionaire
microsites.description: A filterable sticker-book database: how billionaires get rich, how they keep control, and what we can actually say about them with sources.

microsites.title: Brexit: A Trillion Pounds and Counting...
microsites.description: A live counter and “real effects” estimate of the ongoing cost of Brexit.
